title: Local clinic aims to get vaccinations to Native American community
body: The University of Maryland Baltimore is now extending vaccines to the Native American community in the city.|| COVID-19 updates | Maryland's latest numbers | Get tested | Vaccine Info || The Native American community has the highest COVID-19 mortality rate when compared to other ethnicities.Maryland online vaccination site locatorVaccine Data DashboardMaryland vaccination plan FAQsThe clinic is part of an effort to reach more than 65,000 Native Americans who live in the Baltimore-Washington Metropolitan areas."It was easy to get the appointment through the link for the IHS testing. I was able to set up an appointment the same day I went to the link," said Michelle Sauve, a Washington, D.C.,
